channel.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
channel.description:
Hello, I'm a Fedora Core 8 user, and I'm having problems with my sound card. First, when I had Fedora Core 7, everything worked fine (not sure about multi-audio). When I upgraded, it didn't detect the correct driver for my ALC888. I installed the Realtek ALC888 RHEL driver, and it installed the driver as OSS mixer. Audio works fine, but when I try to listen to two things at a time, it is impossible. When I try to play music, it uses the sound, and doesn't let any other app to use the sound. When one sound is playing, another cannot play. This is my problem.
How can I fix this problem?

item.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
item.dc:creator: @Kamu Kamu
item.description:
@Kamu wrote:

[quote=“Rajae, post:5, topic:171521”]Alright, I fixed my audio driver.
All I had to do was follow the instructions for installing ALSA from the ALSA site. I also got multi-audio working. Just needed to follow instructions, thanks for recommending ALSA, or I wouldn’t of known.[/quote]

Nicely played.

Read full topic

item.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Alright, I fixed my audio driver.
All I had to do was follow the instructions for installing ALSA from the ALSA site. I also got multi-audio working. Just needed to follow instructions, thanks for recommending ALSA, or I wouldn’t of known.

Read full topic

item.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
item.dc:creator: @Kamu Kamu
item.description:
@Kamu wrote:

First off, wrong place to ask. Check out the Fedora forums.

rm -rf and try again. Read some guides on getting sound to work. When I did it in gentoo many year ago there was some config file changes needed to be made. Also, OSS is old, the new ALSA is what you should be using.

Read full topic

item.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

I want to listen to more than one thing at a time, and I know that this is possible, because I could do it on windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Listen to one thing at a time.

Read full topic

item.title: Audio device busy? Enabling multi-media?
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Hello, I’m a Fedora Core 8 user, and I’m having problems with my sound card. First, when I had Fedora Core 7, everything worked fine (not sure about multi-audio). When I upgraded, it didn’t detect the correct driver for my ALC888. I installed the Realtek ALC888 RHEL driver, and it installed the driver as OSS mixer. Audio works fine, but when I try to listen to two things at a time, it is impossible. When I try to play music, it uses the sound, and doesn’t let any other app to use the sound. When one sound is playing, another cannot play. This is my problem.

How can I fix this problem?

Read full topic
